title: Reconnect SSH session with floating window fails with warning/error message
author: johnjore
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
Warning / error message "Reconnect (UI.Window.ConnectionWindow) failed. Could not find InterfaceControl" when using "Reconnect" on a floating SSH window.

## Expected Behavior
"Reconnect" command should be run and session restarted

## Current Behavior
Warning / error message "Reconnect (UI.Window.ConnectionWindow) failed. Could not find InterfaceControl" when using "Reconnect" on a floating SSH window/session.

## Step...

iterations.description: Reconnection of SSH sessions fails when the connection window is in a floating state, suggesting a bug in how ConnectionWindow re-initializes or re-associates the underlying SSH protocol handler upon reconnection.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Reconnection of SSH sessions fails when the connection window is in a floating state, suggesting a bug in how ConnectionWindow re-initializes or re-associates the underlying SSH protocol handler upon reconnection.
Approach: Investigate the `Reconnect()` method in `ConnectionWindow.cs` to ensure that it properly disposes of the old SSH protocol object and creates a new one, or re-establishes the connection for the existing one, when called on a floating window. This might involve checking the lifecycle of the `ProtocolBase` or `PuttyBase` instance associated with the `ConnectionWindow` when it's floating versus docked. Special attention should be paid to how floating windows are managed and how their connection state is preserved or restored during reconnection.
